title-part.text: APPLYING CLOSURE MEMBERS TO BOTTLES JARS, OR SIMILAR CONTAINERS
OPENING CLOSED CONTAINERS

reference.text: opening or closing devices attached to, or incorporated in, containers or container closures B65D

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
B67B7/46 covered by B67B7/30-B67B7/385
B67B7/48-B67B7/52 covered by B67B7/24, B67B7/26, B67B7/28
B67B7/54-B67B7/90 covered by B67B7/30-B67B7/385
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Closing bottles, jars or similar containers by applying stoppers
Pretreatment of stoppers, e.g. cleaning, steaming, heating, impregnating or coating
Applying resilient rings to stoppers
by inserting threadless stoppers, e.g. corks
by inserting and rotating screw stoppers
Securing stoppers, e.g. swing stoppers, which are held in position by associated pressure-applying means coacting with the bottle neck
by inserting disc closures
Closing bottles, jars or similar containers by applying caps

CPC-specific-text.text: Pretreatment of caps, e.g. cleaning, steaming, heating or sterilizing
Applying date marks, code marks, or the like, to caps during capping

title-part.text: by applying flanged caps, e.g. crown caps, and securing by deformation of flanges

CPC-specific-text.text: using additional means for securing the cap, e.g. adhesives
the caps being made of thermoplastic material

title-part.text: Cutting caps from strip material in capping machines

reference.text: devices for registering moving strip material B65H23/00

title-part.text: Feeding caps to capping heads

CPC-specific-text.text: the caps having an asymmetric footprint, e.g. comprising a gripping lip

title-part.text: from a magazine
from a hopper

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for orientating the caps to a position ready to be applied to the container

title-part.text: Capping heads for securing caps
characterised by being movable axially relative to cap to deform flanges thereof, e.g. to press projecting flange rims inwardly
characterised by having movable elements, e.g. hinged fingers, for applying radial pressure to the flange of the cap
characterised by having resilient deforming elements, e.g. resilient sleeves or collars
characterised by being rotatable, e.g. for forming screw threads in situ
by applying and rotating preformed threaded caps

reference.text: forming threads in situ by resilient deforming means B67B3/16, by rotary capping heads B67B3/18

CPC-specific-text.text: using manually-controlled or manually operated devices
using friction means for screwing the caps, e.g. belts or guides
using friction means for screwing the caps, e.g. belts or wheels
Means for preventing rotation of the container or cap

reference.text: torque limiters in wrenches or screwdrivers B25B23/14; couplings or clutches per se F16D

CPC-specific-text.text: Electrical means responsive to the torque applied and acting on motor control means, e.g. strain gauges or power measurement means
whereby the applied torque limit is varied

title-part.text: by applying snap-on caps
Special measures for applying and securing caps under vacuum
Applications of control, warning, or safety devices in capping machinery

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for controlling the tightening of threaded caps, e.g. testing the release torque
devices for avoiding damage to the closing machine

title-part.text: Mechanisms for causing relative movement between bottle or jar and capping head
Applying protective or decorative covers to closures
Devices for securing bottle closures with wire

reference.text: infant feeding teats with means for fastening to bottles A61J11/04

title-part.text: Applying protective or decorative covers to closures, e.g. by forming in situ

CPC-specific-text.text: the covers being applied wet, whereby shrinkage occurs on drying

title-part.text: by applying liquids, e.g. by dipping
Devices for securing bottle closures with wire
Closing bottles, jars or similar containers by applying closure members, not provided for in groups B67B1/00 - B67B5/00
Hand- or power-operated devices for opening closed containers

reference.text: nail pullers or extractors B25C11/00; attached to, or incorporated in, containers or container closures

title-part.text: for removing stoppers
Cork-screws

CPC-specific-text.text: Power-operated cork-screws, e.g. operated by an electric motor
without supporting means for assisting the pulling action
with supporting means for assisting the pulling action
having means for varying the effective lever arm length
whereby the supporting means abut around the whole periphery of the neck of the bottle
whereby the supporting means abut around parts of the periphery of the neck of the bottle
adapted to be mounted on walls
Means for varying the lever arm

title-part.text: Other cork removers

CPC-specific-text.text: using one or more blades to be inserted between the cork and the inner surface of the bottle neck
specially adapted for opening pressurised bottles, e.g. champagne or sparkling wine bottles

title-part.text: using air or gas pressure
with means for retrieving stoppers from the interior of the container
for removing disc-closures
for removing tightly-fitting lids or covers, e.g. of shoe-polish tins, by gripping and rotating
finger grapple type
for removing flanged caps, e.g. crown caps

CPC-specific-text.text: the removing device being formed by at least two articulated parts, e.g. pliers
Means for attaching the opener to fingers

title-part.text: for removing threaded caps

CPC-specific-text.text: by use of a flexible loop gripping the cap skirt or the container body by friction
the loop having an adjustable length
Means for attaching the opener to fingers

title-part.text: for breaking vacuum seals between lids or covers and bodies of preserving jars, e.g. by wedge action
incorporating loops, e.g. of wire, which are tightened around seal

CPC-specific-text.text: propelled by rotary gears or wheels around periphery of container
adapted to be mounted on walls

reference.text: machines for domestic use with a plurality of interchangeable units A47J43/06, A47J44/00

title-part.text: Devices for engaging tags, strips, or tongues for opening by tearing, e.g. slotted keys for opening sardine tins

CPC-specific-text.text: adapted for engaging the ring of a pull tab for opening an aperture
and subsequently tearing off the top of the can

title-part.text: Devices for removing barrel bungs
Combination tools, e.g. comprising cork-screws, can piercers, crowncap removers

reference.text: combinations of opening devices with cutting tools B26; with devices serving other purposes, see appropriate subclasses, e.g. B25F; B43K29/00

title-part.text: by breaking, e.g. for ampoules
Indexing codes relating to constructional features of closing machines
Orienting closure means
Stoppers
Cylindrical stoppers
Caps
applying two closures on a container
Details of cap feeding devices
Use of magnets
Aseptic features
Quick or easy connection means for connecting a capping head to a spindle
Details related to spray caps, i.e. caps comprising a pump and a tube for dispensing content from a container
